column4: Hi there, Im a blender3d developer and we often get reports about building on Ubuntu because by default there is no libGL.so
Ofcourse you can manually simlink but this isnt great
Is there some way we can support it?
Blender3d we have a lot of users that build there own but are not devs
how about joining ubuntu packagers or pointing users to your own repo  so theres no need for users to build blender
we have a lot of technical users that build daily
sure they can, but if there was some solution Id like to fix it
so there is no way to link to libGL.so.1?
you might submit a patch, state your background, and packagers might be well happy to include it
user__, would this patch make the symlink?
yes, in the deb build process i guess
user__, hrm, will bug report instead, I mostly use arch, only ubuntu on every other system
you just need to do the ln in $blender-source-deb/debian/postinst/. this gives ubuntu motu a start, they can discuss then anyway
yep, but personally not interested in packaging
